author: robj
msg: OK, looks like CVS is screwing with me.  I apologize for
the raft of cleanups it looks like I must now do.

author: robj
msg: I knew I'd forget something.  Stay tuned, maybe more.

author: robj
msg: I hope I will never have to make another checkin as large
as this.  Changes include:
- tcp transport (probably already deprecated)
- generic ServiceClient replaces (HTTP-specific) HTTPCall
- functional test suite exercises client-server HTTP and TCP
(do "java org.apache.tools.ant.Main functional-tests")
- providers moved to toplevel directory
- MsgDispatchHandler, RPCDispatchHandler refactored
into MsgProvider, RPCProvider
- and more besides....
There may well be problems.  I apologize in advance.
Feel free to call me, 415 861 2606, to work them out
absolutely ASAP tomorrow (today? :-).

author: robj
msg: TestRPC now puts service registry into messagecontext
properties (which seems weird! and hard to remember).
AxisServer now actually pays attention to
getServiceHandler.  All of this must be fixed up because
it is barely working at the moment!

author: robj
msg: Fixed test.RPCDispatch package test by making
TestRPC register its little service in the *service*
registry, rather than in the handler registry.  The
test passes now.
